half life 2
smooth play, engaging, really enjoy it.

Just played this for the first time in February 2022. A peerless achievement. Exceptionally fun and creative. It's made very clear that a highly talented team made this, and that this talent is not limited to just the game engine, level design, textures and world art, writing, animation, or direction, but that all these facets are skillfully rendered. Not quite perfect, but by making reference to the occasional problems, I would be dishonestly shifting the sentiment of this review. Without hesitation I can say: a must play.

10/10 - One of the best game ive ever played.

4.5 Saate Yakındır Oynuyorum Oynun Başları Sadece Combinelerle Savaşırken , Oynun Devamında Ravenholmda Zorlu Düşmanlarla Savaşıyorsunuz. Ben Şuan Ravenholmdayım Ve Size Tek Tavsiyem Mermileri Boşa Harcamayın. Sürülerce Zombi Ve Hızlı Koşan , Çok Vuran Zombiler Var. Çatıdan Çatıya Geçtikleri Bir Bölüm Var Orda Anlarsınız. Ekstra Olarak Oyunda Su Motoru Sürdüğümüz Bir Kısım Var O Motoru Kontrol Etmesi Çok Zor. Devamında Motora Silah Ekliyorlar Ve Silahla Kullanması Dahada Zor Oluyor.

Hl2 is well sick, I'd be surprised if you don't have it if you play PC

I can definitely see why everyone thinks it's a masterpiece... but I don't like it thaaaat much.

For reference, I beat the game on the highest difficulty (which probably doesn't mean that much in this game).

I'm going to come and say head on I liked world of the first Half Life a lot better. Half Life 2's world is still pretty good, but being in Black Mesa during the cascade event is just so much more interesting me than post-cataclysm earth. However the story was definitely more fleshed out here. Dr. Breen "essentially" (not really) controls the world and it's citizens, and you can feel that influence everywhere within the environments and npc's. It felt like everyone had a significant role in the story here, and it pays off.

The game looks amazing on modern hardware. It still felt a little old in places, but it runs way better than the original Half Life while looking like a last gen console game most of the time. 

And the gameplay, just felt like overall improved from Half Life. I was kindof disappointing in the lack of weapon variety here, but that physics gun almost makes up for it entirely with how fun it is to get creative with it.

I'm having trouble thinking of what else I could say, so I'm just going to go ahead and give it an 7/10. I'd rather replay the original Half Life before this, but it is still a worthwhile game that lasts quite a while.

I mean, what do you honestly expect me to say?

[i]Half-Life 2[/i] is just so goddamn good, it was a masterpiece when it released in 2004, it's still masterclass of game design and storytelling in 2022. It's so good that it entirely stands on its own from its predecessor, and for some people including myself surpasses it in ways. It's considered legendary for several very good reasons.

Just play it already. It's $10, you can see the rating, it can run on your toaster at this point, you have literally no reason not to play it if you haven't.

One of the best games i ever played 

Pros:
•Great story & characters
•Great fast-paced gameplay
•Amazing AI
•Great physics mechanics
•Great graphics (for 2004)
•Intricate level design
•Good variety of weapons
•Good variety of enemy types


Cons:
•None


Verdict: A game that is way ahead of it time; in its gameplay, graphics, story, AI, and physics. It is a must play for all gamers.

•10/10.

I didn't have a good time with this game. I'll admit it looks nice and has some good music, and the final area was interesting. Just a shame that actually playing it was uninteresting at best and aggravating at worst. The weapons all felt unsatisfying, gravity gun was fun for the first section and then just became a gimmick, most common enemies felt like light bullet sponges, the driving sequences could have been cut out, and the final section can shove a rusty cheese grater up its ass. Oh yeah and there was plot, I think, where your character felt like he had no real purpose being there and watched as other characters did things. Like strategy games, It really wasn't for me.

3/10 - Just an overglorified tech demo.

Rise and shine, Mister Gamer. Rise and... shine. Not that I... wish to imply you have been sleeping on the job. No one is more deserving of a rest, and all the effort in the world would have gone to waste until... well, let's just say your hour has... come again.

The right man in the wrong place can make all the difference in the world. So, wake up, Mister Gamer. Wake up and... smell the ashes...
